| Documented cleaning procedure in place and easily accessible | Is there a documented cleaning procedure for buildings, equipment and vehicles?  Is this procedure easily available on the electronic and hard copy format? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Latest procedure live on system and hard copy available | Review the header - is it the latest revision, check that the dates and signatures are present on the hard copy Is it a controlled copy? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Natural work group trained | Staff responsible for cleaning adequately trained? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Up to date records table | Is the Records table up to date? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Record compliance | Select a key Records input and verify compliance.  Correct revision in use?  If records are changed after initial recording/entry, are changes clearly legible (errors marked  through and initialed); recorded in ink, not pencil? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Cleaning schedules | Are good standards of housekeeping maintained? Is a condition based or "clean as you go" policy practiced?  Are Cleaning schedules in place for building, equipment and vehicles? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is the frequency and methods of cleaning based on risk? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Do the cleaning schedules include:   * Responsibility for cleaning * Item/area to be cleaned * Frequency of cleaning * Method of cleaning * Cleaning materials to be used * Cleaning records and responsibility for verification |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Cleaning equipment | Is cleaning equipment colour coded to distinguish between uses and areas? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is cleaning equipment stored in such a manner as to prevent contamination and to ensure good hygiene?  Is Equipment used for cleaning of toilets segregated from other equipment |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is cleaning equipment part of regular cleaning and disinfection regime? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Environmental monitoring | Is a microbiological environmental monitoring programme (based on risk) documented and managed to ensure that the cleaning operations are effective in minimising the risk of contamination by microorganisms that would be detrimental to the products? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Cleaning chemicals | Is a list of cleaning chemicals available? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are there any strongly scented chemicals in use? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are Containers identified and locked away in designated location? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are material safety data sheets available for all cleaning chemicals? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Confirmation of suitability for use in food contact environment?  (SABS 1828 and SABS 1853) |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Testing station - Clean as you go policy in place? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Back Gusset Punch Out cleaned and not at potentional risk of contaminating product on all pouch makers? Discarded in appropriate Bin provided? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Euro Slot, Tear Nicks & Rounded Corners Punch Outs cleaned and not at potentional risk of contaminating product on all pouch makers? Discarded in appropriate Bin provided? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Cropped corners from MDB spout inserter cleaned and not at potentional risk of contaminating product? Discarded in appropriate Bin provided? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
